channel.title: STDIN on Allen's Whiteboard
channel.description: Recent content in STDIN on Allen's Whiteboard

item.title: How to Build C++ Projects with STDIN in Sublime Text 3
item.description: I’ve been a die-hard fan of Sublime Text (ST), all the time from the 2nd to the 3rd version now. To be frank, I use ST in almost all situations: taking lecture notes in LaTeX, drafting small projects in Python or R (while for large projects, Jupyter Notebook and RStudio are stronger platforms), or tracking my Todo-list in Markdown. Everything works so smoothly and lightly with ST, especially compared with IDEs like Xcode or Visual Studio.
